comments: Here is the environment I have.1.3.0_20040405_1511 from the eclipse.org site. I downloaded the dependent projects (GEF, EMF, eclipse). I started eclipse. Then I took the source code of org.eclipse.hyades.uml2sd.ui from cvs (dev.eclipse.org) from the branch that is taged hyades_v1_3_0_20040405_1511. I created a probe based on this version of the org.eclipse.hyades.uml2sd.ui. Then I self-hosted. I imported an apache access log and error log and created a time correlation. Then I tried to open the log interaction view. This is when I got the following exception. java.lang.ClassFormatError: org/eclipse/hyades/uml2sd/ui/view/ScrollView (Invalid start_pc/length in local var table) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) Created an attachment (id=9409) class file after probe was applied Created an attachment (id=9410) class file before probe is applied Created an attachment (id=9411) .probe file Created an attachment (id=9412) probekit script Created an attachment (id=9413) java file The class files you attached are corrupt - I see you used a binary file type, but they still aren't happy. I will email you for alternative arrangements. It seems if I specify a package name in the target attribute it does not apply the probe to the specified package. I tried the following .probe file: System.out.println("Counter value " + " at a call to " + _class + "." + _method + " THIS Object "); This worked. It targeted the draw method and excluded the other methods. However, once I add a package the probe does not get called. The previous comment was not for this bug. This is a different bug that I will open. This is a good one. It all comes down to padding. The tableswitch instruction is variable-length: it gets padded so the table length and entries align on a four-byte boundary (counting from the start of the function). Thus the segment of this function after the "entry" insertion actually got SMALLER by being instrumented. This revealed a bug in our local variable table patching logic, which never accounted for entries whose start+length were at the end of the original function. Fixed now: I added a special pass to handle these variable table entries. house keeping
